lines.text: No naked strange pale girl found in my bed on summer morning.
Put on lots of perfume, Ms Smith, everywhere. I like it!
I'll be in bed should you be searching for me, Ms Smith.

Night thoughts, Saturday, October the 3rd. Every girl is a flower garden with a compost heap at the bottom. And many a noble man has had to drown his dwarf wife in a zinc bath or strangle an idiot girl on a muddy common in order to draw attention to himself. Reality betrays us all.
Reality betrays us, Ms Smith!
[Miss Smith is in the bathroom next to the bedroom where Mr Hoffman lays in bed]
Ms Smith. Take a letter.
What?
Take a letter Ms Smith.

[comes out of the bathroom]
Now?
Yes, now! To Miss Janet Smith, care of this address. Dear Miss Smith, go to bed. Your sincerely. Mr Benjamin Hoffman.
Please make yourself look as if you want to be fertilized.
Miss Smith?... Please make yourself look as though you want to be fertilized.
[she is stunned]
What a charming silence you make, Miss Smith.
Come in, Miss Smith.
[she hesitates at the doorway]
Don't weaken, Miss Smith.
Come along, Miss Smith! Blow your lonely nose and come out of there.
The living room is just here... where one lives.
He's mad!
Aspirin.
Where?
In the tea.
Well, I don't want them in the tea.
Ah. Um, they fell in.
Full use. Any man suffering massive sexual frustration would be out of his mind if, getting the girl of his dreams, he didn't put her to... full use.
Love is merely a substitute for liking people.
I smell your hair in my bathroom. I smell your female skin smell in my bathroom. You can't buy that in a bottle.
Is - is this the only -
Only the innocent can lie with conviction, Miss Smith.
I want to eat you. I want to consume you. I want to lick your knees.
All over the world, simple pleasures of the flesh are being ruined by women screaming to be understood.
Girls all over the world are afraid of men with my expression.
What expression?
Plain, sad-faced men.
That's a charming schoolgirl frown you have there, Miss Smith.
Tom's mother says that only French railway workers eat garlic.
You're very witty, Miss Smith.
Really?
Witty and informative. You tell me volumes about Tom's mother in one simple sentence.
I remember the day my father introduced me to snails. "Hello, snails," I said, "How are you?" "Tres bien, merci," they said. "We who are about to be eaten salute you."
Now, Miss Smith, what do you like before going to bed? Cocoa? Acupuncture?

[looking at a picture of Tom]
I hope you're worth it, that's all I can say!
Are you setting up house in the bathroom, Miss Smith?
How will I ever look Tom in the face again?
With guilt, apprehension, remembering the unspeakable - me.
Miss Smith. It's not only homosexuals who don't like women. Hardy anybody likes them.

[to Hoffman, out of his hearing range]
I should've told Tom... and let him kill you!
Many a good man has been destroyed by pity, Miss Smith.
Can you scramble eggs?
Yes.
Your accomplishments never cease to amaze me, Miss Smith.

[repeated]
Oh, mother!

[Hoffman and Miss Smith are at the piano]
And I'll play down here, you play up there - that'll be a duet, or instant cacophony.
There's something I want to ask you.
What is it you want to ask me?
Can I give up going to work?
...Yes.
And can I have piano lessons?
Yes.
From a real teacher?
Yes.
And can I choose the things for the new kitchen?
Yes.
And... and can I -
What you're doing to me is atrocious. It's the filthiest thing I've ever heard of.
Yes, I am filthy, yes, but there's no escaping one's fate.
Miss Smith, you are here to be two arms, two legs, a face, and what fits in the middle.
There are two people in all of us - the child in the snapshot and the monster the child grows into.
What's wrong with the old place?
Oh, well, you know - treacheries, miseries, failure, despair.
Are you hungry?
Women are always hungry for something. Fallopian tubes with teeth.
